reviews.text: I love the Bristol - it is without doubt the best hotel in Warsaw, both in terms of the quality of the hotel and its location. It also has a special place in the heart of everyone who loves this city as it was the only building left standing in the centre of warsaw at the end of the war.

reviews.text: It is on the 'Royal Route' next door to the presidential palace and withing a few hundred metres of the Old Town. You couldnt dream up a better location. The hotel has had a major refurb since my last visit a couple of years ago, and although Im not sure about the quality of the furnishings (in my room very reminiscent of high end kitchen units) its a great improvement on the very chintzy previous look. My room was on the third floor, directly above the front door of the hotel, and I had a lovely full length window overlooking Krakowskie Przedmiescie - with a great view of all the lovely palaces along the street.

The location is great; next door to the presidential palace; 5 minute walk to the royal castle and stare miasto (old town); on beautiful Krakowskie Przedmiescie (which is a busy street with cool restaurants and shops) and 5 minute walk to the tomb of the unknown soldier & Saxon gardens. We didn't have breakfast here, it was easy enough to find cheaper close by at one of the many restaurants nearby. Our room was spacious with a very large bathroom and a view of the Church of the Visitation.

reviews.text: By far the best hotel I've stayed in in Warsaw. The place has a real feel of traditional 'old Europe' charm. True, old, in some cases means a little rough around the edges in part (the public areas are better maintained than the bedrooms for example) but overall, a really beautiful hotel with efficient and attentive staff. And in a great location, by the way.
reviews.title: Charming and traditional

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel bristol for a conference and it was excellent. My room was superb, old world luxury with a modern touch. Loved the fluffy bathrobe and numerous fluffy towels. The location in the old town was fabulous and meant I was able to make the most of the free time I had. The hotel is also really close to the river which is a nice place to go running or walking. I went swimming in the indoor pool and used the sauna which were both very good and completely empty. The staff were wonderful, very friendly and courteous and by the second day the breakfast matire'd had remembered my morning drinks order. The conference room we used was light and airy and the food at break time was very tasty. Everything we asked for was provided and I appreciated the staff member bringing me a latte while I was setting up in the morning. I wouldn't hestiate recommending this hotel as a conference venue, or as a great base to explore Warsaw.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 days in October 2013. The hotel is wonderful. A nice building, very well trained staff and nice food and drinks. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay, the hotel is in a great location for the old town and other major attractions. Both bars are nice and the Café was absolutely stunning. A great room with truly interesting patisserie and very good service. Only 2 things stopped me from giving this hotel 5 stars ( a rare accolade from me). Firstly, the fact that the hotel charges for WIFI in the guest rooms is an absolute insult in this day and age of always connected and social media. We all know how cheap WIFI products and services are so why feel the need to try and "rip off2 he non business customer even more? Secondly, the absolutely ridiculously uncomfortable bar stools in the small wine bar. A lovely bar with views on to the main road but those bar stools! Maybe it is my age but I could not get comfortable on them at all. they look very "trendy2 but are designed so that you slide forward and off the stool at the slightest opportunity. So, we loved the hotel and have talked about it lots since we returned but we cannot forgive the charging for WIFI and the stupid bar stools.
reviews.title: A marvellous hotel - why charge for wifi in this day and age?

reviews.text: We were lucky enough to get an upgrade to a suite, room 603. Wow. Almost got lost in it, no joke. The overall fit out is art deco, both in the lobby and in the rooms (judging by our room). Breakfast was the typical feast of everything you can possibly imagine. Location was great; your neighbour is the president of the country! Easy walk to the Jewish area, and buses along the street out front of the hotel can take you to other sights in the city. Easy walk to restaurant Michel Moran and some posh shops. I would guess this is the nicest hotel in Warsaw.

Very disappointed and think I was punished for checking out one day to travel to another city. Have had reservation for quite a while and booked directly with them so it's not a bargain website reservation. Highly disappointed on this visit! What a wonderful, old world, refined, totally comfortable hotel! Often hotels in Europe (for Americans) lack certain elements we have become accustomed to - great air and heat, friendly staff, comfortable beds and room amenities, etc. This hotel was top of the line in all aspects. And the prices are amazingly reasonable for everything. And the staff across the board were SO FRIENDLY AND ACCOMMODATING. Unlike other places in Europe, the staff here were not only NOT arrogant and unfriendly, but were, rather, so nice, so anxious to please. Next door to the Presidential Palace, this is a jewel of a hotel that I would revisit anytime

reviews.text: Wonderful 'palace' hotel in central Warsaw near the old city and the university. The public areas are typical of Central European 19th century hotels with beautiful decor and high ceilings and plenty of room to relax in. Like most buildings in the area, it would have been rebuilt after WW2 but has been done in keeping with the original. Rooms and bathroom were fine with good air conditioning system. My room looked out over the park to the side of the hotel so was reasonably quiet. Worth noting that the larger 'executive' rooms are at the front looking over one of Warsaw's main thoroughfares and so are likely to be noisier. I didn't try the restaurant but the breakfast was excellent: an extensive buffet with plenty of choice (although for some reason, the food and drinks are spread over different parts of the breakfast rooms so it wasn't obvious what choice there was). Service ok and efficient. Downside: one of the most expensive hotels I've stayed in for internet access.

reviews.text: Think about a dream hotel, where from the concierge to the room maid, from the reception desk to the manager of the hotel all are very friendly, and in the meantime very professional . If you think that such a place cannot exist, then go to the Le meridian Bristol in Warsaw. This is the place where the guest has the real and concrete impression to be important for the hotel. It is not rare to be anticipated in your requests, such is the high attention paid to the client. And don’t forget history: staying at Le Méridien Bristol in downtown Warsaw gives you the privilege to live the experience of living in a place full of history, where the elegance of the interiors architecture – married with the most modern efficiency and the highest comfort - is an invitation to think about the privilege of being in the centre of a town that has suffered so much in the past but without never losing its identity. And so it’s also the Hotel, a place full of history and able to keep – and live – its identity.
reviews.title: The dream is reality

reviews.text: We stayed at the Bristol for 4 nights in April 2011 on a leisure visit with Polish friends from England. Our room was so spacious and the bed was super comfortable. The best night's sleep every night that I have ever had! Breakfast is varied, fresh and as much as you can eat. The waiting staff and hotel porter couldn't do enough for us. We invited two other friends who live in Warsaw with their children for the Sunday Brunch and I was totally amazed at the selection of food on the buffet. For a fixed price you can eat as much as you like and take as long as you like to eat it. I truly recommend this brunch even if you are not actually staying at the hotel. Well worth it. One of the waiters even opened a special bottle of vodka which had caught my eye so that I could have a taste. The hotel is well situated on a wide boulevard within easy walking distance to the main square. I truly loved the whole experience and would recommend it to anyone going to Warsaw.
